section.name: Downloading the JStyx libraries
section.p: Currently the only way to download the JStyx libraries is as a platform-independent installer package in JAR format. The latest version is 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT and you can download it from here.

section.name: Installing the software
section.p:
If you have downloaded the JAR installer (currently the only option) you can start the installer by running:
java -jar jstyx-0.1.0-SNAPSHOT-installer.jar
This has been tested on Windows and Unix. You will need a Java runtime environment version 1.4.2 or above (http://java.sun.com) in order to run the installer (and, indeed, to run the software).

Note: Under Unix, you might find that the scripts do not work: you might get messages like "bad interpreter: no such file or directory" or "Command not found". In this case, the newlines in the script might have been inadvertently converted to Windows/DOS newlines. You can fix this by running "perl -pi -e 's/\r//' *" in the bin/ directory of the installation.

section.name: Uninstalling the software
section.p:
If you installed using the JAR installer, you can uninstall the software by changing to the "Uninstall" directory of the distribution and running
java -jar uninstaller.jar
If you are running Windows, there is probably a shortcut to this uninstaller in the JStyx program group in the Start Menu.
